input:

17:03 Caption: Well-positioned Pablo Piatti (Valencia) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Anthony Lopes reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!

35:36 Event: Foul by Valencia

38:14 Event: Throw-in by Valencia
38:40 Caption: Sergi Darder (Lyon) is able to continue to play.

41:18 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia

41:28 Event: Goal by Valencia
41:46 Caption: Pablo Piatti looks around to decide who he is going to pass to. He picks out Sofiane Feghouli (Valencia), who collects the ball perfectly and unleashes a terrific shot that ricochets in off the crossbar. The score is 0:1.
42:33 Event: Kick-off by Lyon
42:55 Caption: The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jordan Ferri (Lyon) is coming onto the pitch as Sergi Darder cannot continue after picking up an injury.
43:06 Event: Ball out of play

44:26 Event: Throw-in by Lyon
44:30 Event: Ball out of play
44:34 Event: Throw-in by Lyon
44:51 Caption: Lyon keep possession of the ball with some short passes, waiting for the moment to hit the opposition swiftly on the break.
45:57 Caption: CHANCE! Alexandre Lacazette (Lyon) has a shot from inside the box which is deflected and crashes against the crossbar!
46:53 Caption: What a great touch by Jordan Ferri (Lyon) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The referee signals a corner kick to Lyon.
47:15 Caption: Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) swings in the corner, but it's comfortably cleared away.
47:18 Caption: Milorad Mazic has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
47:59 Caption: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has already been more to see prior to the half-time break than there is in most games during the full 90 minutes. We are witnessing quite a balanced game with both teams struggling to prevail. The tactic of the home side is slow build-up play, while the away team's game is based on long passes and crosses into the box.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Lyon
00:00 Caption: Fourth official shows 2 min. of added time.
00:01 Caption: The whistle blows and Milorad Mazic starts the second half.

01:28 Event: Ball out of play

46:25 Caption: Corentin Tolisso (Lyon) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the top right corner. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Jaume Domenech with a fabulous save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Lyon will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
46:26 Event: Ball out of play
46:34 Event: Corner by Lyon
46:48 Caption: Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) takes the ball to the corner flag and sends it into the box.
46:50 Caption: Samuel Umtiti (Lyon) sends a rebound goalwards, low to the right-hand post, but the goalkeeper stretches to stop it. The ball goes behind for a corner. Lyon will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
46:53 Event: Foul by Lyon
46:55 Caption: Mathieu Valbuena (Lyon) steps up to take the corner, but the ball just sails in among the defenders.

47:41 Event: Direct free-kick by Valencia
47:49 Event: Ball out of play
48:10 Caption: Pablo Piatti (Valencia) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The ball goes out of play. Valencia are awarded a corner kick.
48:27 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
48:59 Caption: This is what football should look like. Full of action, thrilling moments and spectacular opportunities. The expectations for the next games will be high. Neither of the teams could take the initiative and dominate today's game. The home side attempted to hold onto the ball for as long as possible. The away team, on the other hand, played long-ball football.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Lyon 0 - 1 Valencia

In a tightly contested encounter that saw a myriad of opportunities for both sides, Valencia edged past Lyon with a crucial 1-0 victory in a match characterized by intense action, missed chances, and strategic plays.

**First Half:**

The game kicked off with Valencia taking the first touch. The initial moments suggested a cautious approach from both teams. Within the first minute, the ball was out of play and Lyon was awarded a throw-in. The pace soon picked up, with throw-ins and ball possessions changing rapidly. Lyon took advantage of an early throw-in at 2:41 but struggled to maintain sustained pressure as the ball frequently went out of play.

Valencia's defensive strategy was evident early on, with the game's first foul occurring in the fourth minute. As Lyon attempted to build momentum, they were met with persistent fouls from the Valencia players. By the eighth minute, Valencia had their first significant opportunity with a corner kick following a free kick. However, their attempt went off target, resulting in a clearance by Lyon.

Lyon's efforts to take control were visible, but simultaneously, they frequently lost possession. By the 15th minute, the French side managed their first shot off target when Alexandre Lacazette's strike was blocked by a defender. Consolidating their defensive stance, Valencia quickly reacted with a clearance.

The subsequent phase of the game witnessed back-and-forth action, punctuated by fouls and frequent stoppages. Lyon's Mathieu Valbuena was particularly active, often crafting opportunities from dead-ball situations. However, Valencia’s defense was resolute. A notable chance for Valencia came at the 17th minute mark when Pablo Piatti’s shot from a rebound was miraculously saved by Anthony Lopes, much to the disbelief of the fans.

The game’s tempo showed no signs of slowing down as fouls continued, punctuating Lyon's attempts to create clear-cut opportunities. As the first half progressed, continuous throw-ins and indirect free kicks showcased the physical nature of the encounter with neither side allowing the other to dominate completely.

Valencia demonstrated their attacking prowess and came knocking again around the half-hour mark, combining patient build-up with quick counter-attacks. Their chance was met with a stern Lyon defense, not allowing easy passage. Meanwhile, Lyon tried to exploit set-pieces but struggled to convert their efforts into tangible results, such as Corentin Tolisso’s shot that went just over the crossbar at the 31st-minute mark.

The high intensity of the clash was palpable as Valencia made a crucial break just before half-time. Sofiane Feghouli, integrating seamlessly with his teammates, latched on to Pablo Piatti's assist to score a magnificent goal at the 41st minute, which saw the ball ricochet off the crossbar and into the net. This goal marked a pivotal moment in the match, providing Valencia with a 1-0 lead.

Immediately after the goal, Lyon pressed to equalize but were faced with a resolute Valencia defense. The half drew to a close with Lyon’s Sergi Darder replaced by Jordan Ferri due to injury. Despite Lyon's persistent pressure, including Lacazette’s shot against the crossbar and Ferri’s follow-up thwarted by the the defenders, Valencia went into the break maintaining their slender lead.

**Second Half:**

As the second half commenced, Lyon resumed play with renewed vigor and a pressing need to find an equalizer. Within the opening minutes, Lyon maintained possession and showcased fluid passing, but struggled to break Valencia’s solid defensive line. Lyon created several chances with Christophe Jallet delivering dangerous crosses into the box, but Valencia’s defense remained resolute.

Valencia's solidity at the back was tested when Lyon earned a corner shortly after the restart, with Alexandre Lacazette’s effort on target being easily saved by Jaume Domenech. Lyon’s subsequent corners also failed to convert into goals, as was the story for much of the match. Mats Valencia defended compactly and cleared numerous threats posed by Lyon.

The match continued with Lyon dominated possession but failing to capitalize on key chances. Lyon’s Corentin Tolisso consistently found good positions, yet his efforts went wide or were deflected. In the 7th minute, Javi Fuego from Valencia received a yellow card, marking a phase where the match’s physicality and fouling crested.

Valencia didn’t just sit back but opportunistically tried to extend their lead with sporadic counter-attacks. Pablo Piatti’s corners and service into the box were posed well but lacked the final touch from their forwards. The second half’s script largely followed a pattern where Lyon launched wave after wave of attacks but to no substantial effect.

As the clock ticked, Lyon saw several more efforts go awry, including unsuccessful shots from inside and outside the box. Ferri received a yellow card in the latter stages, reflecting the mounting frustration within the Lyon camp.

In the 38th minute, Feghouli had a clear opportunity again but was blocked, emphasizing Lyon’s desperate defending. Valencia responded with substitutions to manage their lead, including Danilo coming in for Enzo Perez. As time waned, Lyon’s attempts were characterized by urgency but lacked the precision to breach Valencia’s defenses.

Maxime Gonalons, too, found an opportunity to equalize but saw his powerful shot blocked by the Valencia defense. Final frantic moments saw Lyon earn multiple corners with Mathieu Valbuena at the heart of most set-pieces. Tolisso followed suite with a strong header in the 46th minute but was met with a fabulous save by the Valencia goal-keeper, Jaume Domenech.

Ultimately, the decisive moment came when Valencia successfully repelled a critical corner and a follow-up shot from point-blank range. As the ball was cleared, the referee’s final whistle signaled the end of an enthralling encounter.

To sum up, Valencia emerged victorious with a well-timed goal by Sofiane Feghouli, showcasing an impeccable balance between defensive resilience and clinical finishing. Lyon, on the other hand, will rue their missed opportunities and lack of precision despite their dominance in possession and number of attempts. The game’s intense and physical nature kept the fans on edge throughout, making this contest a fascinating spectacle of European football.
